Installing XEmacs


Installing XEmacs


XEmacs is a powerful, extensible text editor with full GUI support, initially based on an early version of GNU Emacs 19 from the Free Software Foundation and since kept up to date with recent versions of that product. The current version is 19.13.

You can install XEmacs either from the FreeWare CD or from the XEmacs site. If you or your systems administrator plan to recompile XEmacs recompile it using "-O -32". Send me email if you have any problems.

If you install XEmacs from the FreeWare CD for IRIX 6.2 then you will need to fix the XEmacs executable as it is broken in the FreeWare CD. I have placed a good executable (it is compressed using gzip) in /usr/lib/cite/doc/xemacs-19.13-for6.2.gz .

You will first need to uncompress the file (do it using gunzip ). You should then copy the uncompressed file to /usr/freeware/bin/xemacs . The following two commands typed in your shell will do it for you. 

% cd /usr/lib/cite/doc
% gunzip xemacs-19.13-for6.2.gz
% cp xemacs-19.13-for6.2 /usr/freeware/bin/xemacs

For more information on the freeware stuff check out the Silicon Surf Freeware site or check with your SGI representative about the Freeware CD.
